availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Commodore P. McGuire (Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Temperance McGuire. Married to Elizabeth Harris McGuire in Carter County, Kentucky, on February 16, 1861. Father of Laban McGuire, Juda McGuire, and Mary Janetta McGuire. Resident of Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Carter County in 1850. Farmhand in Carter County in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Carter County in 1860. Farmer in Carter County in 1863. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private and second sergeant from September 25, 1863, to December 30, 1864.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film 001759301.
